articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets AP Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets AP Delegation
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Associated Press of the United States headed by its President and Chief Executive Officer Thomas Curley at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.

articles.title: AP Pyongyang Bureau Opens
articles.content:
AP Pyongyang Bureau Opens
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Bureau of the Associated Press of the United States was opened with due ceremony at the Korean Central News Agency on Monday.
					 Present there were the delegation of the Associated Press headed by its President and CEO Thomas Curley.
					
					 Kim Pyong Ho, director general of the KCNA, officials concerned and AP bureau staffers attended.
					
					 Earlier, there were talks between the two delegations at the KCNA.
					
					 An agreement on the establishment of the AP Bureau in Pyongyang was signed.
					
					 Kim Pyong Ho and Thomas Curley inked the agreement.
					
					 Thomas said the opening of the bureau would bring hundreds of millions of people around the world the cultural understanding and access to stories of political and economic development of the DPRK.
					
					 He has great expectations for good journalism, he said, adding this is a great opportunity to just understand and report.
					
					 The participants toured the bureau office.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported by Indian Party Leader
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported by Indian Party Leader
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A. B. Bardhan, general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India, met with DPRK Ambassador to his country Rim Hoe Song on Jan. 10.
					 The general secretary said that his party is sharing the sorrow with the Korean people over the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il that was so sudden and early to their deep regret.
					
					 His party has been encouraged to see the Korean people work hard to build a thriving socialist nation, holding the dear respected Kim Jong Un in high esteem as their supreme leader by turning their great sorrow into strength and courage, the general secretary noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would intensify the anti-imperialist struggle and the drive to defend socialism with the Songun politics under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Communist Party of India will always extend support and solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their efforts to glorify 2012 as a year of proud victory, a year when an era of the prosperity is unfolding, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il, he declared.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Condolatory Message from PM of Belize
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Condolatory Message from PM of Belize 
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a condolatory message from Dean Barrow, prime minister of Belize, on the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 The message said:
					
					 It was with deep grief I heard the sad news that HE Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, passed away on December 17, 2011. 
					
					 At this time of great loss and sorrow for the DPRK, I on behalf of the government and people of Belize express sincerest condolences to Your Excellency and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 Please accept, Your Excellency, the assurances of highest consideration.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Centenarians
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Centenarians
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) --The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent birthday spreads of best wishes to Rim Sung Nyo and Kim Pok Sul on the centenary of their births. 
					 They live in Kunchon-ri, Cholsan County, North Phyongan Province, and Muksan-ri, Kaesong City.
					
					 They were subjected to sorrow, maltreatment and insult as members of a stateless nation in the past.
					
					 It was not until the country was liberated by President Kim Il Sung that they came to lead a worthwhile life. They worked hard true to the agricultural policy of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 They worked on even after they became pensioners. 
					
					 Keeping themselves optimistic in their life, they told their children to work harder for the sake of the socialist country.

articles.title: New Song Enjoys Great Popularity in DPRK
articles.content:
New Song Enjoys Great Popularity in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A new song "Kim Jong Il Is Immortal as Sun" created in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 Today's editions of the country's newspapers, including Rodong Sinmun, frontpage the song and TV and radios broadcast it.
					
					 The song tells that the image of Kim Jong Il, which is as bright as the sun, is always cherished in the hearts of the people and that his great exploits will be conveyed through generations.
					
					 As soon as it was created, the song began enjoying a great popularity in the country.
					
					 An officer of the Korean People's Army, Ko Song Il, told KCNA that the song reflects the Korean people's determination to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leader of Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					 An official of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, Song Hyon Sun, said, "The song deeply moves me to tears. It reminds me of the tireless efforts General Secretary Kim Jong Il made in his lifetime for the happiness of the people. I think the song truthfully represents the desire of the Korean people."

articles.title: Ice Rink Hosts International Figure Skating Festival
articles.content:
Ice Rink Hosts International Figure Skating Festival
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The International Figure Skating Festival for Paektusan Prize takes place before full houses each year at the Ice Rink in Pyongyang to commemorate General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday, February 16.
					 The Ice Rink was opened to mark President Kim Il Sung's 70th birthday on the initiative of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The cone-shaped building, situated on the banks of the Pothong River, has a floor space of more than 25,000 square meters and 6,000 seats.  
					
					 In the basement there are lounges, training rooms, referees' room, gymnastic apparatus repair shop, clinic, soft drink stand and offices.
					
					 The Ice Rink has another building for training used by both players and amateurs.
					
					 Many international and domestic tournaments have been held since its opening. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il visited the Ice Rink on December 4, 2011, before his demise, with the dear respected Kim Jong Un and enjoyed a figure skating demonstration. That day he gave important instructions for the development of ice sports.

articles.title: Hwang Chol, Celebrated Actor
articles.content:
Hwang Chol, Celebrated Actor
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Hwang Chol was one of the Korean artistes who led an honorable life under deep care of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 He was a theatrical actor greatly popular among the Korean people.
					
					 Born on January 11, 1912, he was unhappy as an actor under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists. He could start genuine artistic activities under deep care of the President after the country's liberation.
					
					 He lost one arm by a bomb splinter during a performance before people in a liberated area of south Korea in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-53).
					
					 The President took measures to take him to a hospital. He received treatment at a hospital in the rear in the period of the temporary strategic retreat and in a foreign country later.
					
					 He starred in or directed some movies and dramas. He also enjoyed popularity for reciting poems well.
					
					 He trained many talented actors and actresses and wrote papers, criticisms, notes and essays.
					
					 He was honored with the title of People's Artiste and National Reunification Prize.
					
					 He wrote a good puppet show script to be highly appreciated in an international festival.
					
					 He was a deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly and worked as chief of the National Theatre and vice-minister of Education and Culture.
					
					 He died in June 1961 and his remains were buried at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery in the suburbs of Pyongyang.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il recalled him many times as a talented actor.

articles.title: Hunminjongum, Korean Alphabet, Created in 15th Century
articles.content:
Hunminjongum, Korean Alphabet, Created in 15th Century 
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- 568 years has passed since Hunminjongum, the Korean alphabet, was created.
					 The word Hunminjongum means upright instructions for teaching the people.
					
					 It was made by scholars under deep concern of King Sejong in January 1444.
					
					 Its main characters were 28, with 17 consonants and 11 vowels.
					
					 Its alphabetical order was scientifically arranged, with a clear-cut structure and system.
					
					 Easy to write and speak, it can fully express vocal sounds.
					
					 The creation of Hunminjongum provided conditions for formulating regulations of the Korean national language and ensuring unity in linguistic life.
					
					 The Korean people were almost deprived of their language by the policy of obliterating Korean, pursued by the Japanese imperialists during their colonial rule over Korea (1905-1945).
					
					 After the country's liberation, President Kim Il Sung advanced a policy of independently developing the national language in line with the requirements of the revolution and construction.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il indicated fundamental principles and ways for developing socialist national language and paid deep attention to linguistic research work.
					
					 Now the Korean language is appreciated as a model national one, cultured and popular.

articles.title: Nickel Silver Tray, Present to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Nickel Silver Tray, Present to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A nickel silver tray displayed in the International Friendship Exhibition House is a gift the Karachi Youth Committee of Pakistan for the Study of Kimilsungism presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il in February Juche 71 (1982).
					 Seen in the middle of the tray are a torch of Juche, inscription hoping for good health of the leader on the occasion of his birthday and date.
					
					 The gift mirrors deep reverence of the committee members for him.

articles.title: Saenal, First Revolutionary Newspaper
articles.content:
Saenal, First Revolutionary Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The newspaper Saenal (New Day) was the first revolutionary publication in Korea.
					 In the latter half of the 1920s President Kim Il Sung formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU) with young communists and other organizations involving people of various social strata. 
					
					 With revolutionary organizations increasing, he felt the need to publish a newspaper for educating people in an ideological and mental way.
					
					 Under his guidance preparations were made to start publishing a newspaper.
					
					 He wrote articles to be published in the newspaper he named Saenal.
					
					 The name of the newspaper reflected his intention to save the Korean people from the Japanese imperialists' oppression and liberate the country.
					
					 The first issue of Saenal was brought out in mid-January Juche 17 (1928).
					
					 The first issue strongly denounced the Japanese imperialists for their aggression and colonial plunder and called on the Korean people to fight against them in close unity.
					
					 The newspaper served as a teaching material for revolutionary organizations, including the Saenal Children's Union, and contributed to encouraging the people to fight against the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (5)
articles.content:
Phenomena Witnessed in Mourning Days (5)
Rainbows Seen Untimely
					
					 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A double rainbow was seen in the sky above the Chonghak Workers' District, Phyongsan County, North Hwanghae Province at around 17:15 December 20, a day after the sad news of the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il was reported.
					
					 There was neither rain nor snow that day.
					
					 The rainbow had its both ends resting on two valleys, as if it linked them with each other.
					
					 A rainbow also appeared in the sky above the Party Founding Memorial Tower in Pyongyang at around 15:20 December 23.
					
					 The rainbow hovered in the sky south of the tower plaza, with its one end facing the mourning site built in the plaza.

articles.title: KCNA Dismisses Lee Myung Bak Group's Trumpeting about "Dialogue"
articles.content:
KCNA Dismisses Lee Myung Bak Group's Trumpeting about "Dialogue"
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is now pretending to be interested in the north-south dialogue.
					 Lee Myung Bak in his "special New Year address" blustered that the "door of dialogue remains opened to the north" and the like.
					
					 His minion the minister of Unification echoed his remarks about "building of channel of dialogue" and "unlimited consultation," asserting that he hoped "north would make a good choice."
					
					 It is a preposterous and the height of folly for the worst hooligans to talk about "dialogue" as they rubbed salt into the wounds of their compatriots stricken with bitterest sorrow at the loss of the nation's father.
					
					 Lee is a confrontation maniac who has neither qualifications nor face to talk about dialogue.
					
					 From the very day Lee came to power, he branded the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration which reflected the unanimous desire of all Koreans for national reunification as "documents for operations against the south" and bills unrepairable. It was again the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who scuttled multi-faceted dialogues and contacts overnight though they had been under way between the north and the south.
					
					 When the DPRK proposed dialogue prompted by the desire to save the inter-Korean relations from catastrophe last year, the group persistently turned it down, claiming that "it was a political offensive without sincerity" and "a strategy to take initiative."
					
					 It was none other than the group of traitors which pushed the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war by deploying huge armed forces in the forefront areas fraught with the danger of clashes over the last period of its office.
					
					 The Lee group is the arch criminal who brought the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse though they had favorably developed since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration and a stumbling block lying in the way of national reunification and peace and prosperity.
					
					 These confrontation maniacs dare talk about "dialogue" though they have committed thrice-cursed crimes during the nation's mourning over the great loss. This is another challenge to the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK solemnly declared before the world that it would never deal with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, foolish politicians and immoral under-wits.
					
					 Nevertheless, the group of traitors is shameless enough to let loose a spate of balderdash about "dialogue" from the outset of the year. This is nothing but sheer sophism to evade the responsibility for deteriorating the inter-Korean relations and cover up its unpardonable unethical crimes committed by it against the Koreans.
					
					 With no crafty trick can the Lee group dodge the responsibility for bringing the inter-Korean ties to a collapse and evade the blame for the crimes committed by it during the mourning period.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Flays GNP Ridden with Scams
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Flays GNP Ridden with Scams
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean political camp has been driven to a bay. 
					 Since it suffered a bitter defeat in the Seoul mayoral election last year, the "Grand National Party" has made desperate efforts to get out of its predicament, crying out for "revamping" it. This farce, however, developed into an inter-faction wrangling of the GNP for expansion of the sphere of influence. The political camp has not spent even a single day in peace. To cap it all, there broke out a case of enveloped money. 
					
					 Ko Sung Dok, a lawmaker from the GNP, confessed recently that he returned enveloped three million won which he had received from a pro-Lee Myung Bak candidate for the chairman of the GNP prior to its congress during the 18th term-"National Assembly." The candidate was elected its chairman later, Ko added.
					
					 Even the names of the speaker of the "National Assembly" and the chief presidential secretary for political affairs are mentioned over the suspicion of the enveloped money that stunned the south Korean society.
					
					 It was daily occurrence that scandals broke among confidants of the chief executive in an unbroken chain and every congress of the GNP was dominated by money. The GNP is a centre of money-dominated politics in the true sense of the word. 
					
					 The reality glaringly shows the sign of the downfall of the south Korean regime of traitors. 
					
					 The politics of the traitors forsaken by the people is bound to be accompanied by scandals. 
					
					 The whole society of south Korea cannot but be torn with scandals as Chongwadae and the ruling quarters of south Korea are hell-bent on swindle, illegalities and corruption. 
					
					 It is quite natural for the south Korean people to spit at the corrupt leadership of the GNP which allows briberies during the election of its chairman. 
					
					 No matter how frequently it "revamps" itself, the GNP can never save its destiny as a doomed party. 
					
					 The days of the politicians forsaken by the people are numbered.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Kicking up War Racket
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Kicking up War Racket 
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The puppet minister of Defense and other military brass hats of south Korea are letting loose such bellicose remarks as "strong counteraction" against non-existent "provocation from the north" almost every day from the outset of the new year. The puppet authorities are mulling the signing with the U.S. of the "plan for joint counteraction against local provocation" late this month.
					 Meanwhile, they completed the deployment of ground-to-air guided missiles and launched the training to get familiar with them. They also contemplate introducing from the U.S. laser devices capable of guiding fighters to super-precision bombing. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: This is the worst political military provocation in history as it is little short of leveling rifles and artillery pieces at the fellow countrymen overcome with deep grief over the loss of the father of the nation.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The South Korean warmongers' noisy trumpeting about "provocation from the north," a fiction, is aimed at justifying their racket for military confrontation and further escalating it. 
					
					 The above-said plan of the warmongers at home and abroad itself may push the situation on the Korean Peninsula to a war phase any moment as it remains unstable and is most likely to spark an armed conflict.
					
					 The deployment of the ground-to-air missiles and the projected introduction of the ground target pointing laser devices irrefutably prove that the puppet warmongers are set to implement their heinous scenario for invading the north. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is letting loose such rhetoric as "it is keeping the window of opportunity open" and "its north policy is flexible" in a bid to create impression that it is interested in defusing the tension on the Korean Peninsula and improving the inter-Korean relations. But it admits of no further argument that they are nothing but hypocritical remarks and sheer sophism intended to evade the responsibility for the bedeviled inter-Korean relations and misleading public opinion in a bid to realize their ambition for invasion of the north in collusion with outside forces.
					
					 Those fond of playing with fire are destined to perish therein.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun It Is Urgent to Foil War Moves of S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun It Is Urgent to Foil War Moves of S. Korean Authorities
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- It is an urgent demand for defending the country's peace and the nation's security to foil the war moves of the south Korean hostile forces to invade the DPRK in collusion with outside forces. Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a by-lined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is a vital issue related to the nation's destiny and urgent task required by reality to check and frustrate the war moves of the warmongers at home and abroad.
					
					 If a war breaks out in the Korean Peninsula, it will be Koreans in the north and south who will suffer from it. But in this case outside forces will fish in troubled waters. In case another war breaks out in the peninsula due to the reckless military provocations of warmongers at home and abroad, it is bound to escalate into a nuclear war.
					
					 The Koreans should never allow themselves to fall victim to a nuclear war as they underwent horrible disasters from the war ignited by the U.S. imperialists and their stooges in the middle of last century.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula has long been in the state of neither war nor peace. But the war danger has never been so alarming on the peninsula as now. The pro-U.S. conservative Lee Myung Bak's "government" emerged in south Korea to give top priority to strengthening the alliance for aggression with the U.S. and, consequently, the war moves were intensified, driving the situation on the peninsula into the worst phase.
					
					 Moreover, the saber-rattling committed by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors during the nation's mourning over the great loss to nation deprived the group of the last chance to bring peace and improve the north-south relations.
					
					 The moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to disturb peace have reduced the Armistice Agreement to a dead paper. The Lee group also scrapped the North-South Joint Declaration, nullifying the agreements for defusing the tension and completely blocking the channel of dialogue. It is quite evident what consequences will be entailed by the above-said moves of the warmongers at home and abroad.

articles.title: Chongryon Official Condemns Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Escalate Confrontation with Compatriots
articles.content:
Chongryon Official Condemns Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Escalate Confrontation with Compatriots 
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Ri Ju Hak, chairman of the Fukuoka prefectural headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Friday made public a statement condemning the Lee Myung Bak group for its heinous moves to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					 He said: Since the outset of his office Lee Myung Bak has been hell-bent on sycophancy, treachery and confrontation with fellow countrymen. However, the DPRK has made sincere efforts for reunification, prompted by the patriotic desire to bring about national reunification, the aspiration of all the Koreans, as early as possible, as evidenced by its broadminded proposal for dialogue and negotiations, not asking about his past. 
					
					 But, the Lee group turned down the proposal for dialogue made by compatriots, defying the aspiration and wishes of the fellow countrymen. Worse still, this group of traitors no better than animals rubbed salt into the wounds of the compatriots grieving the passing of the great father of the nation born of Heaven. These confrontation maniacs can never be pardoned.  
					
					 Officials and other compatriots under the Fukuoka prefectural headquarters will join in the nationwide struggle to throw Lee Myung Bak into a graveyard of history, he stressed.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Spanish Organizations
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Spanish Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of the People and the Organization of Young Communists of Spain made public a joint statement on Jan. 5 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					 We fully support the Korean people in their efforts to carry out the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The Spanish communists shared sorrow with the Korean people over the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il last year.
					
					 We also witnessed, through the news of the mass rally held in Pyongyang on Jan. 3, the firm will of the Korean people to turn sorrow into strength and courage and certainly build a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 We offer our sincerest greeting of wishes to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Korean people will continue to build socialism, neither tolerating any infiltration of imperialism nor allowing any compromise with the imperialists.
					
					 We will stand against imperialism and go closely united with the Korean people on the road of socialism.

articles.title: Mexicans to Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Mexicans to Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Mexican National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung was held in Mexico on Jan. 6.
					 Present there were personages and members of the People's Socialist Party, Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, Fellowship Institute to Honor the Memory of President Kim Il Sung, Mexico-Korea Friendship Association and the Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification of Mexico.
					
					 The participants paid a silent tribute to the memory of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the last year's activities of the preparatory committee and discussed measures for commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung more significantly.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's August Name and Venerable Image Will Always Be Remembered
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's August Name and Venerable Image Will Always Be Remembered
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted on its Internet homepage "One Corea Network" on Dec. 27 last year an article titled "General Kim Jong Il, peerlessly great man, always lives in the hearts of the world progressive mankind".
					 The article said:
					
					 The untimely demise of the great General Kim Jong Il is the greatest loss to the Korean and world revolutions and the bitterest sorrow of the Korean nation and the world progressive mankind. 
					
					 His whole life was a noble life of a great leader who devoted his all to realizing the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He made ceaseless journey of field guidance, undergoing all sorts of hardships nobody experienced, only for the prosperity of Korea and the people's happiness.
					
					 Referring to the undying feats he performed for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence, the article went on:
					
					 He won the respect of the world progressive mankind as the peerlessly elder statesman and the sun of the 21st century.
					
					 This was the boundless praise and eruption of deep reverence for him who steered the cause of independence, holding high the banner of the anti-imperialist struggle in the whole period of his guidance over the revolution.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche and the supreme leader of the party, army and people of the DPRK, is standing in the van of the Juche revolution, the Songun revolution. 
					
					 This is, indeed, the greatest fortune of the Korean nation as well as of the progressive mankind.
					
					 The heart of Kim Jong Il stopped beating but his lofty august name and benevolent image will always be cherished in the hearts of the world progressive mankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Personality Praised by Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Personality Praised by Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans are praising the personality of the dear respected Kim Jong Un as a great man.
					 South Korean paper Jaju Minbo carried on Saturday an article titled "Feelings of overseas Koreans after being received by Vice-Chairman Kim Jong Un".
					
					 Overseas Koreans said in general that they felt "kind-heartedness" and "high-spiritedness" from Vice-Chairman Kim Jong Un when they were received by him after paying their respects to the bier of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, displayed at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the article noted, saying:
					
					 Yun Kil Sang, chairman of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S., said: His image gave other persons something comfortable. It gave a dignified yet gentle impression. When I looked at his face, I could feel that his hand shaking was based on warm sincerity, not casual manner.
					
					 Rev. Yu Thae Yong, a permanent editor of Minjok Thongsin, said: After expressing respects to the bier of Chairman Kim Jong Il, I was received by General Kim Jong Un. We did not talk but only nodded.
					
					 From his face and posture, I felt he is very kind-hearted and modest for his high position.
					
					 Ri Jun Mu, head of the New York U Ruk Symphony Orchestra, said: What I felt instantly from his eyes when shaking hands was that he is a good-natured man. A feeling came to my mind that this person would be much loved by the compatriots in the DPRK.
					
					 Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the General Association of Koreans in China, said:
					
					 I felt that he listened carefully to what overseas Koreans said and that his posture was high-spirited. Outsiders and Western media would say that he was young. Anyhow, I didn't have such feeling, but got an impression by his dignified appearance that he is identical to President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Correspondent Ro Kil Nam, who was received by Kim Jong Un when he covered the mourning at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace and paid respects to the bier of Kim Jong Il, said in an interview with Jaju Minbo:
					
					 I felt kind-heartedness and benevolence from him. On August 18, 1990 I was ever received by President Kim Il Sung at Kyongsong Spa in North Hamgyong Province after the successful conclusion of the Pan-National Rally. I felt as if I met Kim Il Sung at the first view of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Other compatriots, too, felt something "kind-hearted" and "warm" from him, the correspondent added.
					
					 Meanwhile, Kim Hong Gol, third son of ex-President Kim Dae Jung, said in an interview with a Japanese media that Vice-Chairman Kim Jong Un looked younger than himself in a photo. Kim Hong Gol visited Pyongyang with his mother Ri Hui Ho to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 "It was my feeling that he is young by appearance and voice, but he was self-possessed when receiving mourners," he added.

articles.title: Palestinian Officials Say Movement Restricted by Israel
articles.content:
Palestinian Officials Say Movement Restricted by Israel
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Palestinian officials said Wednesday that Israel imposed a prohibition on the movement of all the Palestinian National Authority (PNA) officials, including President Mahmoud Abbas.
					 Hanan Ashrawi, an official of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), told that the Israeli authorities imposed these restrictions to limit the Palestinian officials' movement.
					
					 The Palestinian officials said the Israeli measures were in relation to the Palestinian bid for a full membership in the United Nations, in addition to their refusal to resume direct peace talks with Israel and also in retaliation for the Palestine's call on the full stop of the Jewish settlement construction.
					
					 They urged the Israeli authorities to withdraw such measures at once.

articles.title: Bahrain Denies Entry of U.S. Human Rights Group Representative
articles.content:
Bahrain Denies Entry of U.S. Human Rights Group Representative
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Bahrain has denied the entry of a representative of U.S. organization the Physicians for Human Rights (PHR), an official statement published on Wednesday said, adding:.
					 The representative was denied entry because he had no "valid reason" for visiting Bahrain. And the Bahraini authorities have not denied entry of anyone who visits for valid reasons and on account of genuine business. No one, however, is above the law. This is as true in Bahrain as it is other countries of the world."

articles.title: U.S. Drone Kills 4 in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
U.S. Drone Kills 4 in NW Pakistan 
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- U.S. forces present in Afghanistan continue committing air strikes against Pakistanis despite strong protest of the Pakistani government.
					 A U.S. drone Thursday fired missiles on a house near Miranshah in North Waziristan, killing at least four people.
					
					 This touched off strong anger among its population.

articles.title: Guinean President Calls on National Unity
articles.content:
Guinean President Calls on National Unity
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Guinean President Alpha Conde recently called for strengthening the national unity.
					 He said that all the people should achieve national unity irrespective of tribal and local difference and turn out in the effort for the country's development. 2012 will be a year witnessing signal successes in all spheres of state construction, he added.
					
					 The government will strive to supply enough electricity and drinking water needed in the capital city and all other areas of the country, he stressed.

articles.title: Russia Rejects Military Attack and Sanctions on Iran
articles.content:
Russia Rejects Military Attack and Sanctions on Iran 
 Moscow, January 15 (KCNA) -- Gennady Gatilov, deputy foreign minister of Russia, in a press interview on Jan. 13 clarified the country's stand against any military attack and sanctions on Iran.
					 Noting that aggravation of the situation around Iran has been visible recently, he criticized the West for attempting to impose unilateral sanctions on Iran.
					
					 He said that the West's attempt undermines the international efforts to settle Iran's nuclear program.
					
					 "Additional sanctions against Iran, as well as a probable military attack on Iran will be doubtlessly taken in the international community as those pursuing the goal of power change in Teheran," he underlined.

articles.title: Imperialism Is on Decline: Iranian President
articles.content:
Imperialism Is on Decline: Iranian President
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, in a speech on Jan. 12 during his tour of Ecuador, said that imperialism is going downhill.
					 He said that the awakened revolutionary masses are struggling together to build a world free from massacre and oppression and which provides happiness to all people.
					
					 Condemning the shameless acts of the world powers, he said that imperialism is on the decline.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia funcion artistica en Casa Cultural 25 de Abril
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia funcion artistica en Casa Cultural 25 de Abril
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea y Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Estado y el ejercito, presencio la funcion de musica y danza "Enalteceremos siempre a nuestro Comandante Supremo" que se ofrece con exito en la Casa Cultural 25 de Abril. 
					El estuvo acompanado por Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Myong Guk, Pak Jae Gyong, los oficiales y soldados del EPC. 
					
					Los espectadores guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il rindiendole los mas sentidos tributos.
					
					En la escena de la funcion iniciada con la interpretacion del inmortal himno revolucionario "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il" se presentaron diversas piezas como la musica de instrumentos de viento y coro mixto "El camarada Kim Jong Il es nuestro Comandante Supremo", el solo femenino y pangchang mixto de la obra maestra "?Donde esta el querido General?", el solo y coro masculinos "Cancion de la camaraderia", el coro masculino "Ordene, Lider", el coro mixto "La fuerza de Corea", etc. 
					
					El espectaculo llego al climax cuando se recitaba la poesia en narracion "Dilo, Corea", pieza que hace recordar la importancia de las fuerzas armadas, mayor patrimonio de la revolucion dejado por el Dirigente. 
					
					Luego, resonaron estruendosamente las canciones "Pasos" y "Defenderemos a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Un". 
					
					Muy satisfecho de que los creadores y artistas del EPC hayan ofrecido esta funcion magnifica de claros temas ideologicos en que se palpitan el espiritu de la epoca y el impetu combativo, el Comandante Supremo evaluo de altos los exitos logrados por ellos en la ocasion y les expreso agradecimiento. 
					
					Como resultado de la materializacion de las instrucciones del Dirigente en las actividades de creacion artistica, la funcion manifesto patentemente el caracter revolucionario del EPC y mostro profundamente en lo ideologico la firme decision de los militares y civiles de marchar hasta el final en la senda de la revolucion del Songun enarbolando la bandera roja, senalo y agrego que el Dirigente se habria puesto complacido si la hubiera visto. 
					
					En particular, "No tiene fin la anoranza" es la mejor de las canciones recien creadas que me humedecio los ojos, dijo emocionado. 
					
					El Comandante Supremo recordo al cantante del Coro Estatal Benemerito, Im Tok Su, y encomendo a los funcionarios extender a los familiares del fallecido artista su peticion de que ellos compartan siempre el destino con el PTC depositando absoluta confianza en esta organizacion como hizo Im. 
					
					Enseno la mision de las entidades artisticas del EPC y dio preciosas instrucciones para cumplirla. 
					
					Bien conscientes de su mision, las entidades artisticas del EPC deben mantener en las actividades de creacion su atributo de destacamento artistico del ejercito revolucionario y combativo, preciso.
					
					La tarea importante que incumbe a ellas este ano es desarrollar las actividades de propaganda y agitacion artisticas al pie de las trincheras ateniendose a las realidades, instruyo. 
					
					El Comandante Supremo volvio a calificar de excelente la funcion y expreso su esperanza y conviccion de que en lo adelante tambien, los creadores y artistas del EPC interpretaran en voz mas alta y sonora las canciones de lucha para llamar a los militares y civiles al cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Songun del PTC.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop se reune con delegacion de AP
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop se reune con delegacion de AP
　Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ACNC) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio el dia 16 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la agencia noticiera norteamericana AP encabezada por su presidente Thomas Curley.

articles.title: Abierto el Buro de AP en Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a las ancianas que cumplen 100 anos
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado el Buro de la Associated Press (AP)  en Pyongyang en una ceremonia realizada este lunes en la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ACNC).
					En la ocasion participo la delegacion de la agencia norteamericana AP encabezada por su presidente y CEO, Thomas Curley.
					
					Estuvieron presentes, por la parte anfitriona, el director general de la ACNC, Kim Pyong Ho, los funcionarios correspondientes y los miembros del Buro de la AP en Pyongyang.
					
					Con anterioridad, tuvieron lugar en la ACNC las conversaciones entre la delegacion de esta y la de AP.
					
					Kim Pyong Ho y Thomas Curley firmaron el acuerdo sobre el establecimiento del Buro de la AP en Pyongyang.
					
					Thomas dijo que la inauguracion del buro podra dar a cientos de millones de habitantes del mundo el entendimiento cultural y acceso a las historias de desarrollo politico y economico de la RPDC.
					
					El buro tiene grandes expectativas para el buen periodismo, dijo agregando que esto es una gran oportunidad para entender y reportar.
					
					Por ultimo, los participantes recorrieron las oficinas del buro.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita a las ancianas que cumplen 100 anos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a las ancianas que cumplen 100 anos
Pyongyang, 16 de enero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente del pueblo coreano, Kim Jong Un, envio la mesa de alimentos de cumpleanos a las longevas centenarias Rim Sung Nyo y Kim Pok Sul quienes viven en la comuna de Kunchon del distrito de Cholsan de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte y en la de Muksan de la ciudad de Kaesong, respectivamente.
					Nacidas como apatridas durante el colonialismo japones sobre Corea, tuvieron que vivir sometidas a maltratos y humillaciones de toda indole.
					
					Desde que el pais fue restaurado por el Presidente Kim Il Sung, pudieron vivir como humanas.
					
					Trabajaron con sinceridad para implementar la politica del partido sobre la agricultura y no dejaron de trabajar aun despues de ser jubiladas.
					
					Viven ahora con optimismo instruyendo a sus descendientes trabajar mucho por la patria socialista.
